00611 00612 // Pixels and control symbols (RAW) are an 00613 // entire 32-bit word. 00614 hstx_ctrl_hw->expand_shift = 00615 1 << HSTX_CTRL_EXPAND_SHIFT_ENC_N_SHIFTS_LSB | 00616 0 << HSTX_CTRL_EXPAND_SHIFT_ENC_SHIFT_LSB | 00617 1 << HSTX_CTRL_EXPAND_SHIFT_RAW_N_SHIFTS_LSB | 00618 0 << HSTX_CTRL_EXPAND_SHIFT_RAW_SHIFT_LSB; 00619 00620 // Serial output config: clock period of 5 cycles, pop from command 00621 // expander every 5 cycles, shift the output shiftreg by 2 every cycle. 00622 hstx_ctrl_hw->csr = 0; 00623 hstx_ctrl_hw->csr = 00624 HSTX_CTRL_CSR_EXPAND_EN_BITS | 00625 5u << HSTX_CTRL_CSR_CLKDIV_LSB | 00626 5u << HSTX_CTRL_CSR_N_SHIFTS_LSB | 00627 2u << HSTX_CTRL_CSR_SHIFT_LSB | 00628 HSTX_CTRL_CSR_EN_BITS; 00629 00630 00631 // HSTX outputs 0 through 7 appear on GPIO 12 through 19. 00632 int HSTX_FIRST_PIN = 12; 00633 int clk_p = 12; 00634 int rgb_p[3] = { 14, 16, 18 }; 00635 00636 // Assign clock pair to two neighbouring pins: 00637 { 00638 int bit = clk_p - HSTX_FIRST_PIN; 00639 hstx_ctrl_hw->bit[bit] = HSTX_CTRL_BIT0_CLK_BITS; 00640 hstx_ctrl_hw->bit[bit ^ 1] = HSTX_CTRL_BIT0_CLK_BITS | HSTX_CTRL_BIT0_INV_BITS; 00641 } 00642 00643 for (uint lane = 0; lane < 3; ++lane) 00644 { 00645 // For each TMDS lane, assign it to the correct GPIO pair based on the 00646 // desired pinout: 00647 int bit = rgb_p[lane] - HSTX_FIRST_PIN; 00648 // Output even bits during first half of each HSTX cycle, and odd bits 00649 // during second half. The shifter advances by two bits each cycle. 00650 uint32_t lane_data_sel_bits = 00651 (lane * 10) << HSTX_CTRL_BIT0_SEL_P_LSB | 00652 (lane * 10 + 1) << HSTX_CTRL_BIT0_SEL_N_LSB; 00653 // The two halves of each pair get identical data, but one pin is inverted. 00654 hstx_ctrl_hw->bit[bit] = lane_data_sel_bits; 00655 hstx_ctrl_hw->bit[bit ^ 1] = lane_data_sel_bits | HSTX_CTRL_BIT0_INV_BITS; 00656 } 00657 00658 for (int i = 12; i <= 19; ++i) 00659 { 00660 gpio_set_function(i, GPIO_FUNC_HSTX); 00661 gpio_set_drive_strength(i, GPIO_DRIVE_STRENGTH_4MA); 00662 // if (252000 > 900000) { 00663 gpio_set_slew_rate(i, GPIO_SLEW_RATE_FAST); 00664 // } 00665 } 00666 00667 printf("GPIO Done\r\n"); 00668 00669 // The channels are set up identically, to transfer a whole scanline and 00670 // then chain to the next channel. Each time a channel finishes, we 00671 // reconfigure the one that just finished, meanwhile the other channel(s) 00672 // are already making progress. 00673 // Using just 2 channels was insufficient to avoid issues with the IRQ. 00674 dma_channel_config c; 00675 c = dma_channel_get_default_config(0); 00676 channel_config_set_chain_to(&c, 1); 00677 channel_config_set_dreq(&c, DREQ_HSTX); 00678 dma_channel_configure( 00679 0, 00680 &c, 00681 &hstx_fifo_hw->fifo, 00682 vblank_line_vsync_off, 00683 count_of(vblank_line_vsync_off), 00684 false 00685 ); 00686 c = dma_channel_get_default_config(1); 00687 channel_config_set_chain_to(&c, 2); 00688 channel_config_set_dreq(&c, DREQ_HSTX); 00689 dma_channel_configure( 00690 1, 00691 &c, 00692 &hstx_fifo_hw->fifo, 00693 vblank_line_vsync_off, 00694 count_of(vblank_line_vsync_off), 00695 false 00696 ); 00697 for (int i = 2; i < NUM_CHANS; ++i) 00698 { 00699 c = dma_channel_get_default_config(i); 00700 channel_config_set_chain_to(&c, (i + 1) % NUM_CHANS); 00701 channel_config_set_dreq(&c, DREQ_HSTX); 00702 dma_channel_configure( 00703 i, 00704 &c, 00705 &hstx_fifo_hw->fifo, 00706 vblank_line_vsync_off, 00707 count_of(vblank_line_vsync_off), 00708 false 00709 ); 00710 } 00711 00712 printf("DMA channels claimed\r\n"); 00713 00714 dma_hw->intr = (1 << NUM_CHANS) - 1; 00715 dma_hw->ints2 = (1 << NUM_CHANS) - 1; 00716 dma_hw->inte2 = (1 << NUM_CHANS) - 1; 00717 00718 irq_set_exclusive_handler(DMA_IRQ_2, dma_irq_handler); 00719 irq_set_enabled(DMA_IRQ_2, true); 00720 00721 dma_channel_start(0); 00722 00723 printf("DVHSTX started\r\n"); 00724 00725 return TINYENGINE_OK; 00726 } 00727 00728 00729 TinyEngineRendererDVI::TinyEngineRendererDVI(TinyEngineFrameBuffer& fr_buf) : m_frame_buf(fr_buf) 00730 { 00731 // Always use the bottom channels 00732 dma_claim_mask((1 << NUM_CHANS) - 1); 00733 tinyengine_renderer_init(); 00734 }; 00735 00736 tinyengine_status_t TinyEngineRendererDVI::wait_for_vsync() 00737 { 00738 while (v_scanline >= MODE_V_FRONT_PORCH) __wfe(); 00739 00740 return TINYENGINE_OK; 00741 }
